title: Drilling Oats and Medium Red Clover

tasks.task: Assemble custom brackets for a plow.
subtasks: Gather necessary tools for metalworking.
Measure and mark metal sheets for cutting.
Cut metal sheets to size using shears or a plasma cutter.
File edges of cut metal pieces to ensure smoothness.
Drill holes for pivot points and fasteners.
Bend metal pieces into desired shapes using a vise and hand tools.
Weld or solder pieces together to form the custom brackets.
Apply finishing touches, such as grinding weld seams and applying paint or powder coating.
Loosen soil with a shovel or tiller.
Place the plow blade into the ground and check if it cuts to the desired depth.
If necessary, extend or retract the plow blades using controls or hydraulics.
Verify the depth by feeling the resistance or using measuring tape.
Guide the plow through the fields while attached to the tractor.
Monitor the plow's performance and adjust direction or depth as needed.
Check for burrs or clumps in the soil and adjust the plow's settings accordingly.
Plan which crops to plant based on soil health, climate, and market demand.
Prepare the ground for planting by plowing,播种 or other necessary land preparation.
Plant seeds at appropriate depths and spacing, ensuring even distribution.
Apply fertilizers and pesticides as needed to support crop growth.
Monitor crop growth and adjust management practices as required (e.g., watering, weeding, pest control).
Harvest the crops when ripe, using combines or other machinery.

tasks.task: Inspect equipment for wear and tear.
subtasks: Regularly check the plow's blades for nicks or bends.
Lubricate moving parts and replace worn hinges or brackets.
Test the plow's hydraulic systems for leaks or malfunctions.

tasks.task: Apply and maintain a film of Stories on the plow blades.
subtasks: Mix the film of Stories with a solvent or carrier substance as per the manufacturer's instructions.
Apply the solution evenly to the plow blades using a sprayer.
Allow the film to dry completely before using the plow again.

tasks.task: Fix a faulty control lever on the plow.
subtasks: Identify the specific problem with the lever (e.g., stuck, broken, or misaligned).
Disconnect the lever from any connections (hydraulic lines, electrical wires, etc.).
Disassemble the lever to access any internal components if necessary.
Replace any broken parts, adjust moving mechanisms, or clean as needed.
Reassemble the lever and test it for proper operation.

tasks.task: Secure the plow to the tractor.
subtasks: Attach the plow to the tractor's drawbar or implement carrier correctly.
Tighten all securing bolts or pins to the manufacturer's specifications.
Check for any unevenness in attachment and adjust as needed.
